text: "I said to my mother, and Jane, at the Eltons"; and he ran on again for a while with curses.

passages.full_quote: <used>I said to my mother</used>, "Upon my word,ma'am --."

I am sure I have sometimes the oddest dreams in the world -- but if I am questioned about it, I must acknowledge that there was such an idea last spring; for Mrs. Perry herself mentioned it <used>to my mother, and</used> the Coles knew of it as well as ourselves -- but it was quite a secret, known to nobody else, and only thought of about three days

"No, not Mr. Knightley; he declined it from the first; and though I thought he would come, because Mrs. Elton declared she would not let him off, he did not; -- but <used>my mother, and Jane, a</used>nd I, were all there, and a very agreeable evening we had"

passages.fragment: , and Jane , at the Eltons '' ; and he
passages.full_quote: "He was dining with the Randalls family, <used>and Jane, at the Eltons"; and he</used> had seen a look, more than a single look, at Miss Fairfax, which, from the admirer of Miss Woodhouse, seemed somewhat out of place

passages.fragment: '' ; and he ran on again for a while with curses
passages.full_quote: "It's been meat and drink, and man and wife, to me; and if I'm not to have my rum now I'm a poor old hulk on a lee shore, my blood'll be on you, Jim, and that doctor sw<used>ab"; and he ran on again for a while with curses</used>
